attributes.action: Abolish NI contributions for working women caught in the State Pension Age trap.
attributes.background: Women born in the 1950's have been grievously impacted by the change in SPA and have to continue working. Many of these women have earned the full state pension entitlement by making 35+ years of National Insurance contributions. Such women should be exempt from making further NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: As an example, take a woman born in 1953. She leaves school in 1970 and starts work full-time expecting to reach SAP in 2013 and retiring. By 2005 she has completed 35 years of work and is eligible for full State Pension. In 2011 she is told she has to work until the age of 66. By 2013 she has paid a total of 43 years of National Insurance contributions. Now she has to work a further 6 years and continue supporting a system that,by now, she thought would be supporting her.

attributes.action: Give an mandatory prison sentence after a death due to physical assault
attributes.background: My father was killed by a punch to the head in 2004 and has never received justice, the man who killed him received only community service as he done a plea bargain and admitted culpable homicide. If you hit someone and kill them it should be a mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details: No one should be able to enter a plea bargain if they hit someone and the person dies as a result. We all know right from wrong and if you kill someone then justice should serve an instant prison sentence whatever your intentions. We lost my father in 2004 and all the accused got was community service. Where's the justice in that? What does that mean for my poor father who dies of a single punch to the head? He ended up brain dead because of his injury. Help me to stop this.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for gambling companies to accept credit cards
attributes.background:
This petition is looking to tackle the problem of credit card use within the gambling industry.

The use of credit cards allows for a huge debt to be ran up without due diligence carried out.

There needs to be proper regulation on the source of funds used to gamble.

attributes.action: Review the way interest is added to student loans.
attributes.background: Many young people will never afford to pay back their student loan.  Not only does the current system saddle young people with debt, it is not good for their mental health to know the loan is being added to monthly. The proposal here is to review the student loan interest system.
attributes.additional_details: Reducing interest rates, to be in line with the current Bank of England interest rate plus running cost of a non profit making company, seems to be a much better prospect for young people. The government will have to pick up the bill for any remaining loan, once the student is 53 years old. Let’s make a system work where young people can realistically pay their loans off or a system where the government subsidises all loans.

attributes.action: We believe Wythenshawe Community Initiative deserves more funding
attributes.background: Wythenshawe Community Initiative are a child daycare centre that provide a safe space for children to play and be looked after, whilst parents are working. Everyday they have children and parents lining up to get a place in however many are turned away due to lack of funding and staff.
attributes.additional_details:
They are a non-profit organisation, based in Manchester and are for children from the ages of five to eleven. 

In 2017 they fundraised £3,498.52 but this is nowhere near enough to support the centre. Many children who turn up at the centre go without breakfast and staff struggle to provide them with enough food due to the lack of money.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: Suspend foreign aid until the national debt has been payed off.
attributes.background: We have a national debt to service, if we give 14.5 billion by 2021 in foreign aid we are borrowing money to give away whilst we lack funds for domestic programs

attributes.action: Automatic general election on change in the leadership of the governing party.
attributes.background: Given the substantial change in the character of a political party on changing its leadership, it seems undemocratic for the mandate from a general election to automatically transfer to a new leader with potentially completely different policies without consulting the electorate.
attributes.additional_details: The law should be changed to require a General Election if the leadership of the governing party changes.

attributes.action: Ban public smoking outside of designated smoking areas.
attributes.background: After seeing and experiencing secondhand smoke in public and having not chosen to experience secondhand smoke I believe smokers should be obligated to not expose others to smoke. If violated an appropriate fine should be given to offenders.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

https://www.cdc.gov/tobacco/data_statistics/fact_sheets/secondhand_smoke/health_effects/index.htm

https://www.nhs.uk/smokefree/why-quit/secondhand-smoke

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: Require a minimum 30 minute rest break in a 12-hour shift by law
attributes.background: You are entitled to one rest break of 20 mins if you are employed for more than six hours a day. Therefore, even on a 12-hour shift, you are only legally entitled to ONE 20 mins rest break. This Petition is asking Parliament to change the law, to require a longer break time.
attributes.additional_details:
Andrew Griffiths MP, Minister for Small Business, Consumers & Corporate Responsibility replied on 7 June 2018 to my MP's letter: 
"We keep all our employment regulations under review, including the Working Time Regulations (WTR) 1998 which contain the statutory requirements on rest breaks. 

We currently have no plans to review these provisions, the WTR represent the minimum requirements and employers are free to offer more generous terms to their workers through their employment contracts".

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Require every vehicle manufactured to have their lights constantly on
attributes.background: Daytime running lights also known as (Drls) are dangerous, travelling around the country I’ve seen far too many people driving at nighttime with only the vehicle drls on, which unfortunately are only on the front of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: As a professional driver (hgv) I believe drls are very dangerous and all motor vehicles manufactured should now constantly have their lights on, best example car is the Volvo, if the switch is positioned on (0) then the headlights are still on! Several times I have been close to a collision due to this and personally I don’t think it would be fair for anyone to have an accident and potentially injure or even kill a person or family and get punished for it for the sake of making it a legal requirement that vehicle lights are constantly on.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for SIA's to give police more support
attributes.background: Here in my town there are street wardens but after 8pm they sign out they are sia too and from that there is not enough support to the police on busy thursay friday and saturday nights and at times it can be hard to keep the public safe
attributes.additional_details:
I believe there should be more powers for us SIA's like carrying handcuffs and powers of arrest giving out 24 hour town/city bans for behaviours ect and be on pertols and giving police more support and numbers to keep public safe
A police offer said last weekend he was 1 of 10 on duty with 60 cases to deal with on going and over 100 999 callers also tonight there is another team for club pertol of 6 offercers but that's not really enough to keep the public safe in a busy town
We need a change

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.

attributes.action: Allow Robert Rihmeek Williams (Meek Mill) into the UK
attributes.background: Robert Rihmeek Williams'(aka Meek Mill) first taste of prison came at the age of 18 when he was caught carrying a gun while shopping at a local grocery store. He has spent his adult life on probation and has been treated unfairly by police officers and courts.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/26/opinion/meek-mill-criminal-justice-reform.html
 
Meek Mill and 76ers Owner Michael Rubin have decided to help get wrongfully accused convicts in the United States out of prison. In the UK we should revisit Meek Mill's visa application, because not only does he connect with many people here, but he can also help the UK by talking to the youth especially with our alarming knife crime statistics this year alone.

attributes.action: Increase the plastic packaging recycling&recovery target from 57% to 80% by 2020
attributes.background:
The Packaging Producer Responsibility Regulations framework is a positive step but targets do not reflect the urgency of our global plastic pollution crisis: producer target is 57% recycled or recovered by 2020. This is not enough.

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/packaging-producer-responsibilities
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is launching over Christmas 2018 where it still remains a challenge to participate in the gift giving tradition while avoiding single use plastics. 
Consumers need plastic free alternatives.
Excess plastic packaging engulfs our children's toys. 
Toy producers must be pressured to make urgent & significant changes necessary to protect our natural world.
The cheap price of plastic does not reflect the environmental cost. 
Producers profit whilst contributing to plastic pollution.

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use plastic inside of cereal boxes
attributes.background: Most cereal comes packaged in plastic. The single use plastic bags not only are disposable and have a negative impact of our environment, but are unnecessary. Paper bags or no bags at all should be enough as the box contains all the contents.
attributes.additional_details: By stopping the use of plastic packaging inside cereal boxes, it will save the companies money, help reduce the pollution in our oceans and environment, and lower the amount of trash individuals and families produce. Alternatively, paper bags could be recycled and remade into more bags, creating a closed loop recycling system.

attributes.action: Make School Meals More Affordable
attributes.background: I am concerned that some schools are charging exorbitant prices for School Meals which could easily prove costly for parents, long term. As a solution, I would like to see the Education Act amended to cap School Meal prices at a level affordable to low and middle-income earners.

attributes.action: Online retail companies should pay an equivalent to UK high street rates.
attributes.background:
The High Street is suffering, losing thousands of jobs because online suppliers offer low paid jobs in distribution centres that pay minimal local business rates.
 
Many pay low corporation tax and again gain an unfair advantage over British and other tax paying businesses
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/02/amazon-halved-uk-corporation-tax-bill-to-45m-last-year
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45053528
 
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/amazon-now-pay-even-less-13023482
 
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/998509/amazon-uk-tax-high-street-shops-business-tax-income-tax-taxation-system
 
https://www.ft.com/content/8fcf026e-38e0-11e8-8b98-2f31af407cc8

attributes.action: The UK should agree to the UN's Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The Global Compact seeks to safeguard the rights of migrants and reduce the negative effects of sudden high levels of migration, partially by reducing the structural problems in countries that cause irregular migration.  The Compact is simply a framework for co operation and not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Compact pdf - https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/sites/default/files/180713_agreed_outcome_global_compact_for_migration.pdf

UN brief description of Compact's aims: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/migration-compact

attributes.action: Ban the Sale of Puppies and Kittens in Pet Shops in the UK.
attributes.background: It can be hard to resist cute puppies and kittens for sale in pet-store windows. But a closer look into how these stores obtain animals reveals a system in which the high price that consumers pay for “that doggie in the window”.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a victory for the Lucy's Law campaign, which has been calling for the ban to be implemented.

The campaign was named after a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel who was badly treated in the puppy farming system.

attributes.action: Stop the use of plastic milk bottles and return to glass bottles
attributes.background: Plastic milk bottles generate more toxic waste through recycling than the-using 100% recyclable glass milk bottles. Plastic milk bottles are just as bad as non-recyclable plastics and should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details: Refer to BBC program Blue Planet

attributes.action: Posthumously award service medals to the now pardoned WW1 soldiers Shot at Dawn
attributes.background: In 2006 the UK govt granted a pardon to the 306 British soldiers shot at dawn for cowardice or desertion. Whilst that provided some closure for their families, I propose that their living relatives should now receive their service medals as they are as deserving as their fallen comrades.
attributes.additional_details: I walked from the UK to the grave of Stockton’s George Hunter in Esquelbecq, France to ensure that his memory was preserved. His story has been a focus of our commemoration in Stockton on tees and a source of immense comfort to his grand daughter. I believe that in the spirit of reconciliation and understanding she, and the families of the other shot at dawn soldiers should receive the medals that their ancestors earned in the conflict.

attributes.action: Apply national space standards to dwellings allowed by permitted development.
attributes.background: Under permitted development rights offices can be converted into residential units & planning authorities are not allowed to consider the size of the dwellings. This has meant dwellings being created of 15 & 16 sqm in size whereas the national space standards require 37 sqm for 1 adult.
attributes.additional_details: It has been reported that in one property in Barnet, for example, 96% of the 254 flats were smaller than the national minimum space standards with the smallest being 16 sqm. In many cases these will be used by more than one adult and even children and contain no outdoor amenity space. It is possible we are storing up a physical and mental health time bomb by creating dwellings of such a small size.

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees of Universities from £9,250 back to £3000 per year
attributes.background:
The cost of university fees in the UK are unacceptable seeing as public universities are financed by the government. 
It's not fair for students from low socioeconomic backgrounds who struggle finaiacially and students from higher economic background to be expected to pay the same fee of £9,250.
attributes.additional_details:
most uni's in the EU are free ,however, what we are seeing is that Universities are continuing to increase their fees and reduce the grants available. The saddest issue here is all courses cost the same, that means a degree in nursing costs the same per year as denistry. 
As a result it's making higher education more attractive to students who can afford it and making it more difficult for students from deprived areas and low income families make it to uni's due to the fear of burdening loans.

attributes.action: Regulate Airbnb and other short term lets of under one month
attributes.background: Properties are being changed from homes into cheap accommodation. This subjects the Hotel and B&B industry to unfair competition, increases rents as there are less properties available. This is also contributing to homelessness and is destroying local communities
attributes.additional_details: Make it the law that all Airbnbs and other short term lets of under one month have to require a change of use through the Local Planning Authority and be registered. They will also have to apply for the same entertainment and alcohol licences plus food hygiene and health and safety regulations as a Hotel or Bed & Breakfast. They will have to reapply annually for their licence and objections can be raised as in any other licensed premises. The property will also be subject to business rates

attributes.action: Change the flat rate road tax for a light commercial vehicle (LCV)
attributes.background: The current fee is £250 a year when many modern engines have very good CO2 emissions, when older LCV's that spit out black smoke pay £140 a year.
attributes.additional_details: Many small business owners who need LCV's but are being kind to the environment by getting a newer more eco friendly van instead of a cheaper black smoke machine have no choice but to pay the outdated flat rate fee. It should be replaced with a variable rate which reflects emissions.

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and stop homelessness increasing.
attributes.background:
The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable on
limited budgets. Homelessness is on the increase and this tax is helping
towards those figures due to people not been able to pay for the rent shortfall out of their limited benefits.
attributes.additional_details: With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with and making people homeless.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for single-use plastic to be visible or used in TV Advertising.
attributes.background: By removing single use plastic from view, we will decrease its popularity. It will no longer be a novelty to buy coffee in a "fashionable" plastic cup. Instead, bringing your own reuseable cup will become popular. This will force companies using single-use plastics to find a safe alternative.
attributes.additional_details:
We have no time to waste and the battle against plastic must be addressed from all angles. This is a serious threat to our planet,

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45775309

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36882799

Please help me do this.

attributes.action: Install Traffic Lights on M1 J29 Southbound Exit Sliproad
attributes.background: Anyone who regularly commutes using Junction 29 of the M1 will know how much of a problem traffic is at peak times when trying to exit the motorway when travelling southbound.  Installing traffic lights could significantly reduce time spent in traffic and reduce the risk of collisions when exiting.
attributes.additional_details: by signing this petition hopefully we will finally have some much needed traffic lights installed.  This will reduce the amount of collisions that happen on that roundabout, the time spent sat in traffic and also the danger of queuing back onto the motorway at peak travel times.

attributes.action: Require hospitals to have specialist consultants in all fields of trauma
attributes.background: My son was hit by a car and suffered serious injuries, he was rushed to Aintree trauma unit and they put in an induced coma, he suffered head and chest injuries. He was transferred to Walton Neuro who are head and spine specialists, not lungs. My son was in the wrong hospital for his lungs.
attributes.additional_details: My son was in a head and spine specialist hospital who dealt with his head injuries, but he had suffered broken ribs and was sick at the scene and had lung problems. The hospital he was transferred to didn't have a specialist in to treat my son's lungs, if it was a multi specialist hospital my son might of survived. Too many patients are in the wrong hospital for their injuries, there needs to be a range of specialists available.

attributes.action: Boost UK trade and global image by inviting China and Japan to rename islands
attributes.background: Britain is a force for good in the world. Remain and Brexit voters agree that we need to show the world that we are open for business. By brokering a new name for the disputed Senkaku/Diaoyu islands in the East China Sea, the Foreign Office can highlight our shared values - and encourage trade.
attributes.additional_details: China and Japan are the second and third biggest economies in the world and are creating investment and jobs in British industry. They dispute who owns a group of islands in the East China Sea. Resolving the dispute is a matter for China and Japan, but the UK can play a valuable role by symbolically inviting the two governments to rename the islands to reflect their and our shared values - for example the Confucius Islands or the Friendship Islands. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senkaku_Islands

attributes.action: Give Transport for London the suburban metro rail services
attributes.background: In December 2016, the Transport Secretary, Chris Grayling refused to give the Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan the Southeastern, Southern and South Western metro rail services to Transport for London which would give a better service to passengers
attributes.additional_details: Patrick McLoughlin, Grayling's predecessor came to an agreement with Boris Johnson who was Mayor of London at that time that Transport for London should take over the Southeastern, Southern and South West metro line services when their contracts ended. The efficient running of the London Overground service highlights the considerable improvements to the reliability and quality of services that could be achieved for passengers if Transport for London were allowed to run the franchises.

attributes.action: Change the name of the House of Lords to the House of Peers.
attributes.background: This petition is simply to ask the Government to address the patriarchal traditions that still exist within Parliament. They should acknowledge the fact that the House of Lords has contained women since 1958, and therefore should evolve to reflect changing society and the make up of our laws.
attributes.additional_details:
Women were excluded from the House of Lords until the Life Peerages Act 1958 passed to address the declining number of active members. 

The first women in the House of Lords took their seats in 1958, forty years after women were granted the right to stand as MPs in the House of Commons. There are 209 female peers out of 798 in the House of Lords today. Women make up 25% of the total members, compared with 32% for women in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: Require alcohol to be clearly labelled on food products containing it.
attributes.background: Many people boycott alcohol for religious, health beliefs & refuse to come anywhere near it if they are for example recovering alcoholics - whereas just the merest taste of alcohol could lead to fatal consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Make CLEAR LABELLING - ALCOHOL CONTAINED MANDATORY FOR FOOD PRODUCTS.
 
Some religions boycott alcohol 
Alcoholics and other addicts cannot touch alcohol
 
Sometimes alcohol is obscurely written (mince pies / Christmas cakes etc) and not easily detected.
 
Any food product that contains alcohol or was produced with alcohol must have a big label stating alcohol was used in the production of this product.

attributes.action: Improve the safety of Scammonden Bridge
attributes.background: I am hoping that safety measures can be put into place on the Scammonden Bridge over the M62 to try and prevent the increasing number of suicides in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Scammonden Bridge over the M62 is becoming more and more popular for people taking their own lives. Especially over the last few years this number has increased significantly and it was only yesterday that someone lost their life on this Bridge. 

I am hoping with all your support that this issue could be addressed by the government and a metal safety barrier be constructed on the bridge to prevent anymore suicides occurring. 

All support will be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Stop insurers charging interest on monthly payments for motor premiums.
attributes.background: When taking out a motor insurance policy, you either pay for their premiums annually or monthly. However, often, monthly premiums attract high interest rates, making insurance more expensive. This is penalising low income families who can't afford to pay annually.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Traffic Act 1930 made it a legal requirement to hold a valid motor insurance policy if you drive a car on the public highway with at least third party cover. However, many on lower incomes, who rely on their car, have no choice but to pay monthly and therefore penalised with interest loaded on. The law should be changed so they cannot add interest. 

Insurers say it costs to process monthly payments, but considering Direct Line Group, for example, made a £293.8m pre-tax profit in the first half of 2018 (https://www.directlinegroup.com/~/media/Files/D/Direct-Line-Group-V2/reports-and-presentations/h1-results-2018-annoucement.pdf), it's unfair.

attributes.action: Ban inflatable bouncy slides at private and public events
attributes.background: Our daughter, one week after her 4th birthday, broke her arm sliding down and rolling off the end of a bouncy slide. Hearing the agony she was in and the trauma she went through to get better was heartbreaking and would not want any other child to go through this preventable accident.
attributes.additional_details:
After reading news story after news story about serious accidents on bouncy slides, also hearing from friends about children hurting themselves, it seems everyone has a story of some degree about the dangers of these slides and we believe it's cause for a total ban on this equipment.

If you agree, please sign this petition and hopefully we can have this matter brought up in Parliament.

attributes.action: The government should stop ALL foreign aid now!
attributes.background: Issues at home are more important.
attributes.additional_details:
Foreign aid is given to India and they have a space programme 
Foreign aid is given to Pakistan, where Christians have been persecuted
Money should be spent on the NHS, pensions, policing etc.

attributes.action: Make Ofsted inspections every 3 years for all schools, regardless of grading.
attributes.background: Ofsted should inspect all schools regularly, every 2/3 years, regardless of previous inspection results.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to contribute to the Teachers' Pension Scheme
attributes.background: Over 76% of supply teachers are employed through supply agencies rather than schools. They are denied the right to contribute to and access the Teacher's Pension Scheme.  Agencies must be made to pay the Employer's contribution and give supply teachers the same pension rights as other teachers.
attributes.additional_details:
The daily charge to schools by an agency for a teacher can be as much as £100 more than the amount paid to that teacher. Agencies should use this money to pay Employers contributions. 
There is a steady increase in the casual employment of teachers to fill recruitment and retention gaps. 
https://www.teachers.org.uk/edufacts/supplyteachers
https://www.educationsupportpartnership.org.uk/blogs/claire-renn/handling-money-difficulties-supply-teacher
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35911015

attributes.action: Make all recovery trucks and taxis meet all standards of child safety
attributes.background: It is not a legal requirement to have isofix components in recovery vehicles and taxis. We need to change that!
attributes.additional_details: After having a breakdown on a live road at night with a child, we have found out the hard way about this. We purchased the safest equipment for our child and we found ourselves stranded for hours trying to find someone with this capability. Fortunately myself and child got home in a taxi and my husband in the recovery truck. What if I was on my own with a child? We need to make this change for the safety of our children!

attributes.action: Ban homework and only have revision
attributes.background: Homework can cause stress and even mental health issues for students. They have no time for their personal life and just revising would be more effective for exams.

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: Give nurses a better pay deal
attributes.background: Many nurses have been misled over how much they would receive as the result of the recent pay deal. Nurses had been told that they would get  least an immediate 3% pay rise but this is not what happened.
attributes.additional_details: Nurses were expecting a long-awaited and well-deserved pay rise but instead have been left disappointed and out of pocket.
